data.title: Alphanumeric order
data.solution:
o = 'aAbBcCdDeEfFgGhHiIjJkKlLmMnNoOpPqQrRsStTuUvVwWxXyYzZ0123456789'
S = input()

r = ''
for l in o:
    r += l * S.count(l)

print(r)
data.statement:
Sort the letters of the input string [[S]] in alphabetical order where the upper case of any letter should be placed after the lower case. Numbers should be considered after any alphabetical letter and non-alphanumeric characters should be ignored.

<<Example:>>
`Alice is 20 years old` -> `aAcdeeiillorssy02`

testCases.title: Multiple words
testCases.testIn: Neil Alden Armstrong was an American astronaut and aeronautical engineer who became the first person to walk on the Moon in 1969

testCases.title: With no alphanum
testCases.testIn: Hey, Mike... Are you coming? Great!

testCases.title: With no alphanum
testCases.testIn: The Rubik's Cube is a 3-D combination puzzle originally invented in 1974[2][3] by Hungarian sculptor and professor of architecture Erno Rubik. Originally called the Magic Cube,[4] the puzzle was licensed by Rubik to be sold by Pentangle Puzzles in the UK in 1978,[5] and then by Ideal Toy Corp in 1980[6] via businessman Tibor Laczi and Seven Towns founder Tom Kremer.[7] The cube was released internationally in 1980 and became one of the most recognized icons in popular culture. It won the 1980 German Game of the Year special award for Best Puzzle. As of January 2009, 350 million cubes had been sold worldwide,[8][9][needs update] making it the world's bestselling puzzle game[10][11] and bestselling toy.[12] The Rubik's Cube was inducted into the US National Toy Hall of Fame in 2014.[13]

data.constraints:
Length of [[S]] â‰¤ 1024
Only ASCII characters are considered.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> Output string with all the alphanumeric characters sorted according to the convention.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Sort the letters of the input string S in alphabetical order where the upper case of any letter should be placed after the lower case. Numbers should be considered after any alphabetical letter and non-alphanumeric characters should be ignored.

Example:
Alice is 20 years old
-> 
aAcdeeiillorssy02
Input
Line 1 : Input string S.
Output
Line 1 : Output string with all the alphanumeric characters sorted according to the convention.
Constraints
Length of S ≤ 1024
Only ASCII characters are considered.
Example
Input
Jordan
Output
adJnor
